sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Samathanam)
articles.description: Gradients are a powerful CSS feature. We use them for texture, depth, and even to hide parts of elements with CSS masking. This article covers another interesting way to use gradients — as a hover effect that affects the appearance of other elements around the hovered element.
articles.title: Gradients, Blend Modes, And A Really Cool Hover Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: Pratik Joglekar takes a philosophical approach to remind designers about the lost joy within themselves by effectively placing massive importance on mindfulness, introspection, and forward-looking. Without joy, the work we do would feel meaningless. To prevent it from happening, check out a few ideas that would help rediscover that spark of joy.
articles.title: Rediscovering The Joy Of Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: Is the Test Pyramid really dead? Discover the more contemporary testing strategies and evaluate the Test Pyramid’s relevance in today’s software development practices.
articles.title: Long Live The Test Pyramid

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: In this article, Joas Pambou builds the tool to provide a sentiment score in **real-time** with enhanced user experience by providing multilingual support. You will use an OpenAI library called Whisper that transcribes audio files into text and detects the language, and Gradio, a UI framework, to establish the interface.
articles.title: Generating Real-Time Audio Sentiment Analysis With AI

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s get ready for September with some fresh wallpaper designs! Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this collection come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: A September Of Never Ending Adventures (2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: The CSS Color Module Level 4 specification defined a slew of new color features when it became a candidate recommendation in 2022, including Oklab and Oklch, which have widened the field of color we have to work with. Explore the Oklch color space and how to start using it in CSS today.
articles.title: Falling For Oklch: A Love Story Of Color Spaces, Gamuts, And CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: The so-called “Double Diamond” is a great way of visualizing an ideal design process — but it’s just not the way most companies deliver new projects or services. Andy Budd proposes a new “Double Diamond” idea that better aligns with the way work actually gets done and highlights the place where design has the most leverage.
articles.title: Improving The Double Diamond Design Process

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: We often think of shadows in CSS as something to reach for when we want to add depth to a design. But shadows can be used for more than depth. Let’s experiment with different shadows — two CSS properties and a filter — to make interesting hover effects, different text styles, and even casting shadows on other shadows.
articles.title: A Few Interesting Ways To Use CSS Shadows For More Than Depth

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Costa Alexoglou)
articles.description: Discover how to improve the user experience of nested menus and tackle a minor yet common issue with them when the user’s pointer leaves the menu item for a moment, and the nested menu goes away, requiring the user to re-hover and try again. A well-known concept called the “safe triangle” solves this problem.
articles.title: Better Context Menus With Safe Triangles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mike Herchel)
articles.description: The background image used in the hero component, which is slow to load, is a very common problem with any component that uses a large image file as a background image. In this article, Mike Herchel walks you through how to tackle this common performance issue using modern techniques.
articles.title: Modern Methods For Improving Drupal’s Largest Contentful Paint Core Web Vital

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lars Kappert)
articles.description: Most of the projects have at least a few unused files, exports, and dependencies lying around, often because it’s difficult knowing when one thing relies on another and scary removing something you’re not sure is in use. Lars Kappert shares a tool he’s been working on that offers a solution.
articles.title: Knip: An Automated Tool For Finding Unused Files, Exports, And Dependencies

articles.author: Neha sharma
articles.description: ReactJS is one of the most popular JavaScript libraries for building scalable and performant applications.  When you're working on ReactJS projects, whether they're large or small, you'll need to focus on code quality, readability, maintainable, and scalability.  Writing good code will also help you reduce PR comments from
articles.title: How to Improve Your ReactJS Code – Tips for Code Readability and Performance

articles.author: Chris Williams
articles.description: I've been meaning to get my Terraform associates certification for some time now, but something always got in the way.  Finally I was able to sit down and work my way through the study materials. Currently Andrew Brown and I are creating two Terraform Bootcamps: one for beginners [https://terraform.cloudprojectbootcamp.com/]
articles.title: Terraform Certified Associate (003) – How to Study for the Exam

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Have you ever dreamt of designing a video game but found yourself hesitant because of the coding aspect? Well, you can create your own came without code! We just released a course on the freeCodeCamp.org that will guide you through the creation of a wave defense game, all without having
articles.title: Create a no-code game with GDevelop

articles.author: Tantoluwa Heritage Alabi
articles.description: There are many Python packages we use to solve our coding problems daily. Take, for instance, the library "Beautiful Soup," – it doesn't come with Python by default and needs to be installed separately.  Many projects rely on libraries and other dependencies, and installing each one can be tedious
articles.title: Python Requirements.txt – How to Create and Pip Install Requirements.txt in Python

articles.author: Manish Shivanandhan
articles.title: EternalBlue Explained – An In-Depth Analysis of the Notorious Windows Flaw

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: Today I'm joined by Patrick San Juan, a software engineer who first learned to code in his 30s. I've known Patrick since the early days of freeCodeCamp. He has always been a positive, supportive force within the community. Patrick grew up the son of first-generation immigrants from the Philippines. His
articles.title: Podcast: Learning to Code in your 30s with Patrick San Juan

articles.author: Eamonn Cottrell
articles.description: You read that right – you can practice web scraping without leaving your happy place: Google Sheets. Google Sheets has five built-in functions that help you import data from other sheets and other web pages. We'll walk through all of them in order from easiest (most limited) to hardest (most
articles.title: Web Scraping with Google Sheets – How to Scrape Web Pages with Built-in Functions

articles.author: Md. Fahim Bin Amin
articles.description: Installing software on Linux is usually easier, or at least that's what it seems like. But this is usually not the case as we've come to a realization that installing and configuring some specific tools on Linux might be more time-consuming than on Windows or MacOS. An example of this
articles.title: How to Install Java in Ubuntu – JDK Linux Tutorial

articles.author: Md. Fahim Bin Amin
articles.description: String concatenation is a common task that we do often. String concatenation is the operation of joining character strings end-to-end. For example, the concatenation of "snow" and "ball" is "snowball". In this article, I will be showing two methods by which you can concatenate strings in JavaScript. I will also
articles.title: How JavaScript String Concatenation Works – the "+" Operator vs the "+=" Operator

articles.author: Tiago Monteiro
articles.description: > “Any fool can know. The point is to understand.” - Albert Einstein Object-oriented programming is a popular way to write computer programs. Because of this, all programmers should understand what OOP is, what languages you can use to program this way, and why it is important. When asked in
articles.title: Object-Oriented Programming in Python – Explained in Plain English
